item.title: Persistent use of parking bay, 30th September
item.description:
Lime bike distributors are using additional parking spaces to drop off bikes. Car parking spaces are valuable around here, so if you can't fit them in the designated bay take them somewhere else and dump them.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Semley Gate, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree destruction, 30th September
item.description:
The council are felling all of our street trees that once absorbed the pollution from speeding cars also allowed by our council. They felled this 100 year old tree this week. It was perfectly healthy. A few months ago the councils own bin lorry was speeding down n green lanes and crashed and destroyed an ancient oak tree, The council have decimated the borough and are entirely ill educated in environmental matters.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Lanes, Palmers Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Food waste from restaurant and emptied bins, 30th September
item.description:
A lot of raw bones have been dumped right outside my front door and you can smell it in my flat. Along with raw food is a lot of rubbish and filled bins. This is disgusting and will attract vermin and foxes easily. Plus the dirty raw food smell in my ground floor apartment. Right outside 3 Surrey Squares door.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Surrey Square, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping , again and again, 30th September
item.description:
Iâ€™ve lost count on how many times this spot has accumulated sacks of trash that never gets collected. PLEASE get to the bottom of this. The same person has been dumping trash here over and over and over again, itâ€™s not only unhygienic, it really STINKS

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Adolphus Road, Hackney, London
